detaileddescription.para: Convenience macro to be used when an asynUser is not yet available.

briefdescription.para: Convenience macro to be used inside the firewireDCAM class.
Number of image buffers the dc1394 library will use internally.
Read back the current bandwidth (int32, read)
Specific asyn commands for this support module.

detaileddescription.para: These will be used and managed by the parameter library (part of areaDetector).

briefdescription.para: Number of asyn parameters (asyn commands) this driver supports.
Feature mapping from DC1394 library enums to a local driver enum The local driver identifies a feature based on the address of the asyn request.

detaileddescription.para: The address range is [0..DC1394_FEATURE_NUM-1] and the dc1394 feature enum starts at an offset of DC1394_FEATURE_MIN...

briefdescription.para: Only used for debugging/error messages to identify where the message comes from.
dc1394 handle to the firewire bus.
Global bus lock to ensure dc1394_capture_setup and dc1394_video_set_transmission in startCapture are done not interrupted.

memberdef.name: pix_lookup
memberdef.initializer: = { { DC1394_COLOR_CODING_MONO8, NDColorModeMono, NDUInt8 }, { DC1394_COLOR_CODING_RGB8, NDColorModeRGB1, NDUInt8 }, { DC1394_COLOR_CODING_RAW8, NDColorModeBayer, NDUInt8 }, { DC1394_COLOR_CODING_YUV411, NDColorModeYUV411, NDUInt8 }, { DC1394_COLOR_CODING_YUV422, NDColorModeYUV422, NDUInt8 }, { DC1394_COLOR_CODING_YUV444, NDColorModeYUV444, NDUInt8 }, { DC1394_COLOR_CODING_MONO16, NDColorModeMono, NDUInt16 }, { DC1394_COLOR_CODING_RGB16, NDColorModeRGB1, NDUInt16 }, { DC1394_COLOR_CODING_RAW16, NDColorModeBayer, NDUInt16 }, }

detaileddescription.para: This function need to be called only once to initialise the firewire bus before FDC_Config() can be called. The bus will be first be reset, then scanned for cameras and the number of cameras and their hexadecimal ID will be printed to stdout.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *portName, const char *camid, int speed, int maxBuffers, size_t maxMemory, int disableScalable)
memberdef.name: FDC_Config

briefdescription.para: Configuration function to configure one camera.

detaileddescription.para:
This function need to be called once for each camera to be used by the IOC. A call to this function instanciates one object from the FirewireDCAM class.
portName
Asyn port name to assign to the camera.
camid
The camera ID or serial number in a hexadecimal string. Lower case and upper case letters can be used. This is used to identify a specific camera on the bus. For instance: "0x00b09d01007139d0".
speed
The bus speed to be used. This indicates whether to use the bus in 1394A or 1394B mode. Valid values are: 400 or 800. If an invalid value is entered the function will always default to 400 (legacy mode).
maxBuffers
Maxiumum number of NDArray objects (image buffers) this driver is allowed to allocate. This driver requires 2 buffers, and each queue element in a plugin can require one buffer which will all need to be added up in this parameter.
maxMemory
Maximum memory (in bytes) that this driver is allowed to allocate. So if max. size = 1024x768 (8bpp) and maxBuffers is, say 14. maxMemory = 1024x768x14 = 11010048 bytes (~11MB)
disableScalable
Disable scalable modes if this is 1

briefdescription.para: This is areaDetector plug-in support for firewire cameras that comply with the IIDC DCAM protocol.

detaileddescription.para: This implements the FirewireDCAM class which inherits from the areaDetector ADDriver class.
The driver uses the Linux libraries dc1394 and raw1394.
Author: Ulrik Kofoed Pedersen Diamond Light Source Ltd, UK. Created: November 2008
